skill.name: bioservices
skill.description: Primary Python tool for 40+ bioinformatics services. Preferred for multi-database workflows: UniProt, KEGG, ChEMBL, PubChem, Reactome, QuickGO. Unified API for queries, ID mapping, pathway analysis. For direct REST control, use individual database skills (uniprot-database, kegg-database).
skill.summary: Primary Python tool for 40+ bioinformatics services. Preferred for multi-database workflows: UniProt...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill includes executable Python scripts that call external bioinformatics services and write local output files. No credential harvesting, environment access, or external command execution is present. Risk is limited to user-directed network calls and filesystem reads and writes.

content.value_statement: You need reliable access to many bioinformatics databases without custom API code. This skill provides ready workflows and mappings across UniProt, KEGG, ChEBI, and ChEMBL.
actual_capabilities: Search UniProt and retrieve FASTA sequences
Run BLASTP similarity searches with NCBIblast
Analyze KEGG pathways and export CSV and SIF outputs
Map identifiers in batches using UniProt mapping
Cross reference compounds across KEGG, ChEBI, and ChEMBL
Query PSICQUIC interactions and QuickGO annotations
limitations: Requires network access to external bioinformatics services
BLAST requires a valid email address and can take minutes
Scripts require the bioservices Python package to be installed
Large pathway analyses can be slow without using the limit option

use_cases.title: Protein analysis run
use_cases.description: Retrieve a protein sequence, run BLAST, and list related KEGG pathways in one workflow.

use_cases.title: Compound ID mapping
use_cases.description: Map KEGG compounds to ChEBI and ChEMBL identifiers for downstream analysis.

use_cases.title: Teaching pipeline demo
use_cases.description: Demonstrate multi database queries using UniProt, KEGG, and GO annotations.

prompt_templates.title: Single ID mapping
prompt_templates.prompt: Map UniProt ID P43403 to KEGG and list the KEGG gene identifiers.

prompt_templates.title: Compound cross reference
prompt_templates.prompt: Find the KEGG compound ID for Geldanamycin and map it to ChEBI and ChEMBL.

prompt_templates.title: Pathway export
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze KEGG pathways for hsa and save summary files to ./output.

prompt_templates.title: Full protein pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the complete protein analysis workflow for ZAP70_HUMAN with my email and skip BLAST.

output_examples.input: Map UniProt ID P43403 to KEGG and list the KEGG gene identifiers.
output: Next step: Use KEGG pathway lookup for hsa:7535

best_practices: Provide a valid email address when running BLAST jobs
Use the limit option for large pathway analyses
Save outputs to a dedicated directory for reproducibility
anti_patterns: Running BLAST without checking job status
Passing empty or mixed organism codes to KEGG queries
Overwriting results by reusing the same output file name

faq.question: Which platforms are supported?
faq.answer: It works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code through the skill interface.

faq.question: What are the usage limits?
faq.answer: Limits depend on each external database and network conditions.

faq.question: Can I integrate with my own scripts?
faq.answer: Yes, the scripts can be run directly and adapted for custom pipelines.

faq.question: Is my data sent externally?
faq.answer: Only the queries you submit are sent to external bioinformatics services.

faq.question: What should I do if requests fail?
faq.answer: Check your network, reduce batch size, and retry with a longer delay.

faq.question: How does this compare to single database skills?
faq.answer: This skill unifies multiple databases, while single database skills offer more direct control.
